body:
Recently, the Senior Staff team has been discussing a lot about getting updates out there for the community to interact with, and support the staff team. Thus, we've got some new updates.


Suggestion Rooms on Teamspeak: http://prntscr.com/80s4ur

If anyone has a suggestion, you can get on Teamspeak and input/discuss your suggestions with players or staff members. All suggestions will be noted and discussed by Mods and Seniors, based off the majority vote, it'll get either implemented or denied. If any trolling goes on within the channels, you will get punished accordingly


AutoClicker is now a Permanent Ban. (Suggested by: Qwuiblington)

Although the post got locked, he made a good point. We've discussed and agreed that 15 days is too lenient for Autoclicker. Thus, it's now a Permanent Ban at first offence.


Inappropriate Names:

All names which have curse words in them will now be punishable, if you have any questions regarding a name, don't hesitate to ask a Mod+.


Have a wonderful day/night.

replies.body: Do you got an Auto Clicker detector? :P
replies.body_tagged: Do you got an Auto Clicker detector? :P

replies.body:
Ok, good, autoclicker will result in a perm-ban from now on but tell me, how are the staff going to know if someone is autoclicking without a plugin?

From my knowledge, autoclickers/macros can't be seen nor detected through spectating since they don't really give us clues for them to be caught. Maybe, people with a bit more experience might see some signs of autoclicking by the way the other person hits/looks like, but still the result wouldn't be 100% accurate since no one's a god at that. 

That's why I'm saying a plugin would be pretty good for the server, so iif you get one to work, I'm guessing me and the community will be more than thankful for the contribution.

replies.body: An autoclicker plugin has to be detecting rhythms from past clicking speed. Say my auto clicker is on 9.5 cps to 10.5 cps, but it does the same everytime, so say 9.5, .77, .92 etc, then they should be automatically banned. Also, if someone is clicking over 20 CPS consistently then they're autoclicking.
replies.body_tagged: An autoclicker plugin has to be detecting rhythms from past clicking speed. Say my auto clicker is on 9.5 cps to 10.5 cps, but it does the same everytime, so say 9.5, .77, .92 etc, then they should be automatically banned. Also, if someone is clicking over 20 CPS consistently then they're autoclicking.

replies.body: How come you are allowed to swear in chat but not have a swear in your username?
replies.body_tagged: How come you are allowed to swear in chat but not have a swear in your username?

replies.body: As long as it is not offensive
replies.body_tagged: As long as it is not offensive

reply_to.body: How come you are allowed to swear in chat but not have a swear in your username?
reply_to.body_tagged: How come you are allowed to swear in chat but not have a swear in your username?

replies.body: As you're probably already aware, swearing in chat is condoned as long as it's not rudely directed at anyone, and it's done sparingly as opposed to excessively. Having even an inoffensive swear word in your username would likely violate the latter condition, since it would appear not only every time you send a message in the chat, but every time you score a kill — or get a kill scored on you — or someone mentions your name (among other potential instances). That's just my guess, at least, since it would make sense.
replies.body_tagged: As you're probably already aware, swearing in chat is condoned as long as it's not rudely directed at anyone, and it's done sparingly as opposed to excessively. Having even an inoffensive swear word in your username would likely violate the latter condition, since it would appear not only every time you send a message in the chat, but every time you score a kill — or get a kill scored on you — or someone mentions your name (among other potential instances). That's just my guess, at least, since it would make sense.

reply_to.body: How come you are allowed to swear in chat but not have a swear in your username?
reply_to.body_tagged: How come you are allowed to swear in chat but not have a swear in your username?

replies.body:
In chat, you're allowed to swear as long as it's not excessive or directed towards anybody.
It also depends on the context.

Inappropriate usernames are in a grey area because everyone has a different opinion on what's appropriate and what isn't. 

So by implementing this rule, it will makes things slightly eaiser to tell whether a name's appropriate or not.
replies.body_tagged:
In chat, you're allowed to swear as long as it's not excessive or directed towards anybody.
It also depends on the context.

Inappropriate usernames are in a grey area because everyone has a different opinion on what's appropriate and what isn't. 

So by implementing this rule, it will makes things slightly eaiser to tell whether a name's appropriate or not.

Well done zeus for making this and really taking suggestions into account, i thank you for that.

But regarding the autoclick plugin or whatever make sure it is created well and it has had a lot of field testing before it is implemented because gee you can go wrong with an autoclick detection plugin. If it does go wrong you are going to have so many false bans.
